title: Dog'Maw and Sewn Chaos
body:
So first off, I love Kog'maw, and I like the idea of Dog'Maw. I really do. I always call him the void pupper, and I understand the thematic match and honestly really want either a cat or dog skin for him, and was really hoping that april fools would give me one. However, if Sewn Chaos was taken off of the PBE for being artistically below par, I think Dog'Maw must be the same. 

The Void VFX are an awful match for the skin, which itself is a bit of a far cry from Kog's normal silhouette and recognizability in-game. Two of the first things I noticed is the effectively invisible passive, and the subtle yellow glow on his W activation. Both of these are terribly difficult to see, and are way too subtle for what should be clear moments of danger in the champ's kit (AOE true damage and his auto-attack steroid). 

The model itself, is also just... off. The tongue hanging out is cute, but along with the severely oversized head and weird googly eyes, it just seems strange, as does the spiked collar (although I understand both fill the dog theme). What I don't understand is why they didn't go the same champ-in-costume route that they did with Meowkai, Dino Gnar, MooCow AListar and cottontail Fizz, where it is very evident that is is simply the normal champion dressed up like another. 

This isn't a thread about me liking or not liking the skin, simply arguing that if Sewn Chaos were removed for artistic inferiority/ champion visibility mismatch, Dog'Maw should be reworked until it is in a better place and can then be released. 

(as a side, can we use those new blue watery particles for deepsea? thx)

replies.body:
Dog'Maw has watery/slobber VFX, no void/green VFX. :)
We also updated its death VFX, and W activate.  Those updates should be on PBE soon enough.
Never mind those few weird vocal people who has a strange crusade going against the skin, Pug'Maw is _amazing_ and I'm so looking forward to seeing it in-game!

> [{quoted}](name=Solideus,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=rIUNUl8Z,comment-id=00020001,timestamp=2017-03-08T10:50:51.404+0000)
>
> Never mind those few weird vocal people who has a strange crusade going against the skin, Pug'Maw is _amazing_ and I'm so looking forward to seeing it in-game!

It doesn't seem like a few.  What we're seeing is that this skin is *really* polarizing.  Some people are loving it and some people are absolutely hating it.

Thanks for the reply!!!

I meant Void audio, my mistake!

(but how bout them watery effects for deepsea eh? pretty plz?)

> [{quoted}](name=GeneralMarkinOff,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=rIUNUl8Z,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-03-08T07:14:14.847+0000)
>
> Dog'Maw has watery/slobber VFX, no void/green VFX. :)
> We also updated its death VFX, and W activate.  Those updates should be on PBE soon enough.

It isn't Kog.  That's the big problem with it.  It's a weird mutant dog-thing.  If it were Kog with a cartoonishly obvious dog costume like Dinosaur Gnar then I think I would be okay with it.  Bonus points for having those big googly eyes bouncing around on top of his head.

But as it is I can't stand the thing.

Sorry, this owner of all the current Kog skins is going to be sticking with Reindeer.  Hard to beat singing while exploding on people.
But why does it look like a shitty custom fan skin, you pulled the sewn chaos skins for not being "good" enough, why add this horrible thing.
But Kog'maw is a weird, out of place creature on Valoran. If he just looked like a dog, he wouldn't be recognizable as Kog'maw, and so they're just playing up his goofiness.
I agree. It just doesn't seem to fit League's visual aesthetic very well. Pug'Maw looks like a 3d model from a completely different game.

Pug'Maw suffers the same problem Super Kennen does. 

The champion bones themselves are extremely dated compared to others, otherwise these would be pretty damn good skins. 

The problem also lies in the fact that these are "April Fool's sklins" so they tend to release 4 or 5 at the same time, so all of them being legendary quality isn't really possible unless they want to push back their planned schedule with skins.
